briefTitle: Olanzapine Combined With Fosaprepitant, Ondansetron, and Dexamethasone for Preventing Nausea and Vomiting in Patients With Testicular Cancer
officialTitle: A Phase III Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Cross-over Study to Evaluate Olanzapine Combined With Fosaprepitant, Ondansetron, and Dexamethasone for Preventing Nausea and Vomiting in Patients With Testicular Cancer Receiving 5-day Cisplatin Combination Chemotherapy

primary.measure: Percentage of Participants With Complete Response From 0 to 240 Hours After Initiation chemotherapy
primary.description: Complete Response was defined as no vomiting and no use of rescue medication

secondary.measure: Percentage of Participants With minimal nausea
secondary.description: Minimal nausea was defined as \<25 mm on a visual analog scale

secondary.measure: Percentage of Participants with total control
secondary.description: total control was defined as no vomiting, no rescue antiemetics, and no nausea
Number of rescue medications for nause and vormitting

secondary.measure: Time to Treatment Failure in each group of participates
secondary.description: Time to treatment failure was defined as time to 1st emetic episode or use of rescue medication

The patient was asked to evaluate his satisfaction with the control of nausea and vomiting by recording two scales: Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale and The Functional Living Index-Emesis questionnaire
